## Preface

The following topics from @bird21 **Section M:** Statistics and probability are covered as part of the statistics component of ENGEN102.

- Mean, median, mode and standard deviation (pg. 743--750).
- Probability (pg. 751--763)
- The Normal distribution (pg. 771--779).
- Sampling and estimation theories (pg. 792--804).
- Significance testing (pg. 805--821).

::: {.callout-warning appearance="simple"}
This is not an exhaustive list of all topics covered in the statistics component of ENGEN102.
:::

- *t*~0.975~(*&nu;* = 59) = 2.00
- *t*~0.95~(*&nu;* = 79) = 1.66
:::

### Practice Exercise 311

<ol>
  <li value="2"> *t*\*~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 8) = 1.86, *t*~0~ = 2. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 80 %, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* > 80 %, at the 5% significance level
  <li value="4"> *x&#772;* = 10.38, *s* = 0.34, *t*\*~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 19) = 1.73, *t*~0~ = 1.70. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 10.25 kN, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* > 10.25 kN, at the 5% significance level
  <li> (a\) *t*\*~[0.975]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 9) = 2.26, *t*~0~ = 3.16. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 0.5 cm, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* &ne; 0.5 cm, at the 5% significance level  
(b\) *t*\*~[0.995]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 9) = 3.25, *t*~0~ = 3.16. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 0.5 cm, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* &ne; 0.5 cm, at the 1% significance level
  <li> (a\) *t*\*~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 5) = 2.02, *t*~0~ = 3.38. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 8000, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* > 8000, at the 10% significance level  
(b\) *t*\*~[0.99]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 5) = 3.36, *t*~0~ = 3.38. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;* = 8000, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;* > 8000, at the 2% significance level
</ol>

### Practice Exercise 312

<ol>
  <li> *t*\*~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 79) = 1.66, *t*~0~ = 1.28. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~B~ &minus; *&mu;*~A~ = 15, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~B~ &minus; *&mu;*~A~ > 15, at the 5% significance level
  <li> *t*\*~[0.975]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 49) = 2.01, *t*~0~ = &minus;2.35. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ = 0, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ &ne; 0, at the 5% significance level
  <li> *t*\*~[0.995]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 4) = 4.60, *t*~0~ = &minus;1.32. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ = 0, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ < 0, at the 1% significance level
  <li value="5"> (a\) *t*\*~[0.99]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 11) = 2.72, *t*~0~ = &minus;1.93. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~A~ &minus; *&mu;*~B~ = 0, is not rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ > 0, at the 1% significance level  
(b\) *t*\*~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 11) = 1.80, *t*~0~ = &minus;1.93. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~A~ &minus; *&mu;*~B~ = 0, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~1~ &minus; *&mu;*~2~ > 0, at the 5% significance level
  <li> *t*\*~[0.95]{.ch-0}~(*&nu;* = 4) = 2.13, *t*~0~ = 3.71. ^[&starf;]{.tomato}^  
Hence the null hypothesis, H~0~: *&mu;*~Unleaded~ &minus; *&mu;*~LPG~ = 0, is rejected in favour of the alternative, H~1~: *&mu;*~Unleaded~ &minus; *&mu;*~LPG~ > 0, at the 5% significance level
</ol>
